intro: Gilia pharnaceoides var. harknessii, commonly known as the Harkness' gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The species is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for various pollinators.
